_header: The might of the Father Almighty
Note: For other MSS see 1953; for the East Midland recension see 5399; for an abridged and altered text see 788; for extracts see 1099, 5628; for a versified list of contents in one manuscripts see 5562.
Bibliographic Ghosts: Untraced, Present whereabouts unknown olim Neale, sold Sotheby’s 1920; Hope Allen Addit. MS III; olim Harmsworth; olim Beeleigh Abbey (Christina Foyle), sold Christie’s June 2000 = Wellesley, MA, Wellesley College Pricke of Conscience [De Ricci 8; Sotheby’s Sale 1922, lot 376]; San Marino, CA, Henry Huntington Library HM 130 [olim Phillipps 3126], f. 1: East Midlands recension, 5399.
_description: The Pricke of Conscience, sometimes attributed to Richard [Rolle of] Hampole

BodAsh52.First Lines:
þe myth of þe fader almythtyþe wit of þe sone
                    alwittyAnd þe godnesse of þe
                    holygostAnd oure lord of mythtes most…
BodAsh52.Last Lines:
…To whilke place he vs all bringeþat for vs vouched saue
                    on rode to henge

BodAsh60.First Lines:
The myȝt of þe fadir almyȝttyThe wisdom of þe
                    sone al wyttyThe grace and þe goodnesse of þe holi gostO god
                    and oo lord of miȝt most…
BodAsh60.Last Lines:
…ȝif he hope þat god is almyȝttyAnd he þat
                    shal it here oþer see
BodAsh60.Note:
Last 21 lines missing. Between the lines ‘To eken her peyne for
                    her synne’ (f. 87v) and ‘The eiȝte peyne as þe
                    book sheweþ us’ (f. 104) of Part VI is an insertion of Latin prose
                    which contains 2385.
BodAsh60.Attributed Title:
Incipit stimulus consciencie a Ricardo Heremitta de Hampole compositus
                        gracie dei subdito terminatur (f. 8)

Bod99.First Lines:
þE myht of þe fadyr al myhtyþe wyt of þe sone
                    al wyhty…
Bod99.Last Lines:
…To þe qwilk place he us bryngþat for us on rode
                    hyng
Bod99.Attributed Title:
Incipit liber qui vocatur stimulus conciencie (f. 8v);
                        Explicit liber qui vocatur stimulus conciencie (at the end)

BodDig14.First Lines:
The myȝt of the fader almygtythe wyt of the sone al

BodDig14.Last Lines:

                    gan honge

BodDou126.Last Lines:

                    schul be bounden foot and hande

BodDou141.First Lines:
þE myȝt of þe fader al myȝtiþe wyt of
                    þe sone al wytti…
BodDou141.Last Lines:
…To whyche place he vs alle bryngeþat for vs voched saue
                    on rode to hynge
BodDou141.Attributed Title:
Stimulus conscientie (f. 1), Explicit tractatus qui dicitur

                    þe prykke of consciense. Here endeþ þe sermon þat a clerk
                    made þat was clepyd alquyn to Gy of warwyk (at the end)

BodeMus76.First Lines:
The myȝth of the Fader almyȝtyThe wysdom of the sone alle
                    witty…
BodeMus76.Last Lines:

                    hyng
BodeMus76.Attributed Title: Here endith the pryk of Conscience (f. 127)

BodeMus88.First Lines:
He sayþ in his wordes leued þeyAn loued his louynge as
                    þey coude sey…
BodeMus88.Last Lines:
…To þe whyche place he vs alle bryngeþat for oure
                    loue made heuen& erthe & alle þynge
BodeMus88.Attributed Title:
Here endeth the tretys that ys called the prykke of concience (at the
                    end)

BodEngPoeta1.First Lines:
ÞE miht Of þe ffader AlmihtiÞe Wit Of þe sone
                    Al witti…
BodEngPoeta1.Last Lines:
…To whuche place he vs alle bringeÞat for vre hele on
                    Roode can hinge Amen

                    to here…

                    dauȝter þat was her dere

Hon strong god is & mitthiHon man greued god þat dot not

[ ]rede of deþ þat he efte schulde drye[ ] for peynes

                    is gnawyng wr[ ]

Lam492.Attributed Title:
Hic inc liber qui vocatur stimulus consciencie et ex dictis doctorum
                        colligitur atque tractatur et dividitur in septem partes videlicit prima
                        pars de natura humana secunda de mundo tercia de morte quarta de purgatorio
                        quinta de die Iudicii sexta de penis inferni septima pars de gaudiis
                        celi (f. 1, rubric)

StPauls47G3.Note: A fragment of the The Pricke of Conscience in  Johannes Buxtorfius, Thesaurus Grammaticus linguae sanctae Hebraeae. Basle, 1616.

                    þe sone Alle wytty…

…And þe materys to herte wyl takeIt may hys conscyence
                    tendyr make…

SocAnt288.First Lines:
…þat seye a deuyl in his figure Rythþat he for
                    drede of þat syth…
SocAnt288.Last Lines:
…& he þat shal it heryn or se& may nout þer
                    by steryd be…
SocAnt288.Note:
Begins at l. 2319 and ends imperfectly at l. 9604. On ff.
                        1-12v is sixteenth-century transcription of ll. 1384-2320,
                    modernized.

Chetham8008.First Lines:
Of þe las worlde w[ ]Bot aftyrward w[ ]Of þe more
                    world [ ]Can I pas fro þis m[ ]…
Chetham8008.Last Lines:
…Þe tretis diuerse honouris may beþat god men in
                    heuyn schal fele & se
Chetham8008.Note:
Missing lines l-1047; ends at line 9082; outer edge of first page
                    damaged by damp.

RylandsEng90.First Lines:
The myȝt off þe fadur almyȝti[T]he Wisdom off
                    þe sone al witty[T]he grace and þe goodnesse of þe holi
                    gostO god and o lord off miȝtes most…
RylandsEng90.Last Lines:
…To which good he ous bringeÞat for ous fouched saff to
                    henge

RylandsEng50.First Lines:
The myghte of the f[ader] almyghtiThe witte of the [ ]And
                    godenes als of the h[oli] gostThe wheche is lord of myghtes
                    moost…
RylandsEng50.Last Lines:
…To þe wheche place he vs alle bringeThat for oure heele
                    on roode con hinge
RylandsEng50.Note: Damaged by damp on first folio.
RylandsEng50.Attributed Title:
Stimulus concientie (f. 1); Explicit hic quidem tractatus vocatus
                        stimulus conscientie ffinito libro sit laus & gloris cristo (p.
                    204)

RylandsEng51.First Lines:
…And ȝaf hym skille witt & myndefforto knowe gode
                    & illeAnd þerto ȝaf hym witte & skillefforto chese
                    or forto holde…
RylandsEng51.Last Lines:
…To þe which place he vs alle bringeþat for vs made
                    heuen erþe & al þinge
RylandsEng51.Attributed Title:
Her endeþ þe pricke of conscience ffinito libro reddatur
                        gloria cristo Qui scripcit carmen sit benedictus Amen (f.
                        116v)

Ushaw50.First Lines:
Alle þat will knowe þe sciens [ ]What ys þe prikke
                    of consye[ ]…
Ushaw50.Last Lines:
…[ ]folwe here kynde & passe it nowht[ ] loveþ his
                    makere & hym worchepis

HarEng515.First Lines:
…But gret perel ys þat man ynneÞat haþ wyt
                    & mynde & wol not lerneRyȝtwys werkes and godes laweBy
                    þe wuche men schul be saue…
HarEng515.Last Lines:
…To þe whuche ioye he vs bryngeÞat of nouȝt
                    haþ made alle þingeAmen amen so mote hyt beSeye we alle par
                    charyte

Chicago329.First Lines:
The mighte of þe fader al my3tyþe wit of þe sone
                    alle wittyAnd þe goodnesse of þe holy goostGod & lord of
                    myȝtes moost…
Chicago329.Last Lines:
…To the whiche ioyes that haue noon endeGod bringe vs thidre
                    whan we hennes wendeAnd that it mote so beWith herte stedfaste Amen
                    say we
Chicago329.Attributed Title:
Here than endes the tretice alle / Which that men Prik of conscience kalle
                    / Explicit Expliceat sic benedictus eat / Amen (f. 99/p. 197)

Chicago33.First Lines:
…And lacketþ ȝong men þat now are seeneHe is
                    oft seeke & ay gronande…
Chicago33.Last Lines:

                    tretis with þe sentence…

YaleBeiOsa13.First Lines:

YaleBeiOsa13.Last Lines:

XRossell Hope Robbins,   and  John L. Cutler.
